This <FI>is<Fi> the book of the generations of Adam. In the day that God created man, in the likeness of God made he him;
Male and female created he them; and blessed them, and called their name Adam, in the day when they were created.
And Adam lived an hundred and thirty years, and begat <FI>a son<Fi> in his own likeness, after his image; and called his name Seth:
And the days of Adam after he had begotten Seth were eight hundred years: and he begat sons and daughters:
And all the days that Adam lived were nine hundred and thirty years: and he died.<CM>
And Seth lived an hundred and five years, and begat Enos:<RF>Enos: Heb. Enosh<Rf>
And Seth lived after he begat Enos eight hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters:
And all the days of Seth were nine hundred and twelve years: and he died.
And Enos lived ninety years, and begat Cainan:<RF>Cainan: Heb. Kenan<Rf>
And Enos lived after he begat Cainan eight hundred and fifteen years, and begat sons and daughters:
And all the days of Enos were nine hundred and five years: and he died.
And Cainan lived seventy years, and begat Mahalaleel:<RF>Mahalaleel: Gr. Maleleel<Rf>
And Cainan lived after he begat Mahalaleel eight hundred and forty years, and begat sons and daughters:
And all the days of Cainan were nine hundred and ten years: and he died.
And Mahalaleel lived sixty and five years, and begat Jared:<RF>Jared: Heb. Jered<Rf>
And Mahalaleel lived after he begat Jared eight hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters:
And all the days of Mahalaleel were eight hundred ninety and five years: and he died.
And Jared lived an hundred sixty and two years, and he begat Enoch:
And Jared lived after he begat Enoch eight hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:
And all the days of Jared were nine hundred sixty and two years: and he died.<CM>
And Enoch lived sixty and five years, and begat Methuselah:<RF>Methuselah: Gr. Mathusala<Rf>
And Enoch walked with God after he begat Methuselah three hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:
And all the days of Enoch were three hundred sixty and five years:
And Enoch walked with God: and he <FI>was<Fi> not; for God took him.<CM>
And Methuselah lived an hundred eighty and seven years, and begat Lamech:
And Methuselah lived after he begat Lamech seven hundred eighty and two years, and begat sons and daughters:<RF>Lamech: Heb. Lemech<Rf>
And all the days of Methuselah were nine hundred sixty and nine years: and he died.<CM>
And Lamech lived an hundred eighty and two years, and begat a son:

And he called his name Noah, saying, This <FI>same<Fi> shall comfort us concerning our work and toil of our hands, because of the ground which the LORD hath cursed.<RF>Noah: Gr. Noe: that is Rest, or, Comfort<Rf>
And Lamech lived after he begat Noah five hundred ninety and five years, and begat sons and daughters:
And all the days of Lamech were seven hundred seventy and seven years: and he died.
And Noah was five hundred years old: and Noah begat Shem, Ham, and Japheth.<CM>
